author: pepaee
content:
Hey guys, we just shared our universal enshrined encrypted mempool (EEM) EIP proposal publicly, which we think could really level up Ethereum's base layer neutrality and make it more attractive to everyday users and institutions alike.
It would be awesome if you could share as widely as possible, so we can get quick feedback from the wider community on this!

As a reminder, here are some of the key aspects of this:

- especially designed to fit into ePBS (and we think it sort of naturally aligns with ePBS very well)
- encryption technology agnostic (generalized encrypted mempool interface, open to multiple key providers, who could use e.g. TEE or t-FHE)
- adds the possibility of scheduling transactions into the future, with certain execution guarantees
- optionally, it also has the potential to fix what flashbot brought up as the "builder free option problem" in ePBS via an additional round of encryption
